script.text: Build a table of all concepts edited in the current release cycle.
Create function to remove character symbols from Snomed CT expression
Defines procedure that tests that terms that contain EN-GB language-specific words are in the same GB language refset.
Defines procedure that tests that terms that contain EN-US language-specific words are in the same US language refset.
Defines procedure that tests that terms which contain case sensitive words have the correct case significance value assigned.
Defines procedure to test the validity of concept ids in the SNOMED CT expression for LOIC mapping.
Defines procedure to test the validity of concept ids in the MRCM Domain Refsets.
Defines procedure to test the validity of concept ids in the MRCM Attribute Range Refsets.

New inactive states follow active states in the CONCEPT snapshot.
New inactive states follow active states in the DESCRIPTION snapshot.
New inactive states follow active states in the DEFINITION snapshot file.
New inactive states follow active states in the ASSOCIATION REFSET snapshot file.
New inactive states follow active states in the ATTRIBUTEVALUE snapshot.
New inactive states follow active states in the SIMPLE MAP REFSET snapshot.
New inactive states for existing components must have active states in the previous SIMPLE REFSET snapshot.
All language refset members inactivated in current snapshot must have been active in the previous release.
All stated relationships inactivated in current release must have been active in the previous release.
All relationships inactivated in current release must have been active in the previous release.
All relationship concrete values inactivated in current release must have been active in the previous release.
The ids should be unique across the stated and inferred relationship snapshot files.
The ids should be unique across the description and text definition snapshot files.
Changes from the the current extended map delta file must be in the current full file

The MDRS effectiveTime should always equal the sourceEffectiveTime.
The MDRS sourceEffectiveTime should always be equal or greater than the targetEffectiveTime.
The MDRS dependencies must be transitively closed.
The association Refset moduleId,effectiveTime pair should always respect the MDRS.
The attributevalue Refset moduleId,effectiveTime pair should always respect the MDRS.
The complexmap Refset moduleId,effectiveTime pair should always respect the MDRS.
The concept moduleId,effectiveTime pair should always respect the MDRS.
The description moduleId,effectiveTime pair should always respect the MDRS.
The expressionassociation Refset moduleId,effectiveTime pair should always respect the MDRS.
The extendedmap Refset moduleId,effectiveTime pair should always respect the MDRS.
The lang Refset moduleId,effectiveTime pair should always respect the MDRS.
The mapcorrelationorigin Refset moduleId,effectiveTime pair should always respect the MDRS.
The moduledependency Refset moduleId,effectiveTime pair should always respect the MDRS.
The mrcmattributedomain Refset moduleId,effectiveTime pair should always respect the MDRS.
The mrcmattributerange Refset moduleId,effectiveTime pair should always respect the MDRS.
The mrcmdomain Refset moduleId,effectiveTime pair should always respect the MDRS.
The mrcmmodulescope Refset moduleId,effectiveTime pair should always respect the MDRS.
The owlexpression Refset moduleId,effectiveTime pair should always respect the MDRS.
The relationship-concrete-values moduleId,effectiveTime pair should always respect the MDRS.
The relationship moduleId,effectiveTime pair should always respect the MDRS.
The simplemap Refset moduleId,effectiveTime pair should always respect the MDRS.
The simple Refset moduleId,effectiveTime pair should always respect the MDRS.
The stated-relationship moduleId,effectiveTime pair should always respect the MDRS.
The textdefinition moduleId,effectiveTime pair should always respect the MDRS.
All module dependency rows should be in the module dependency refset.
Target modules in the MDRS must have the same version.
ID is unique in CONCEPT snapshot.
ID is unique in DESCRIPTION snapshot.
Active Fully Specified Name associated with active concepts is unique in DESCRIPTION snapshot.
ConceptId value refers to valid concept identifier in the DESCRIPTION snapshot.
There is a 1:1 relationship between the id and the immutable values in the description snapshot.
ID is unique in the DEFINITION snapshot.
There is a 1:1 relationship between the id and the immutable values in the DEFINITION snapshot.
ConceptId value refers to valid concept identifier in the DEFINITION snapshot.
There is at most one active definition per concept per dialect.
ID is unique in the ASSOCIATION REFSET snapshot.
There is a 1:1 relationship between the id and the key values in the ASSOCIATION REFSET snapshot file.
Referencedcomponentid refers to valid concepts in the ASSOCIATION REFSET snapshot file.
TargetComponentId refers to valid concepts in the ASSOCIATION REFSET snapshot file.
ID is unique in the ATTRIBUTE VALUE snapshot.
Referencedcomponentid refers to valid concepts in the ATTRIBUTEVALUE snapshot file.
ValueId refers to valid concepts in the ATTRIBUTE VALUE snapshot.
ID is unique in the SIMPLEMAP REFSET snapshot.
There is a 1:1 relationship between the id and the key values in the simple map refset snapshot.
Same terms but using different cases will be considered as duplicates in the DESCRIPTION snapshot .
ID is unique in the SIMPLE REFSET snapshot.
There is a 1:1 relationship between the id and the key values in the SIMPLE REFSET snapshot.
Referencedcomponentid refers to valid concepts in the SIMPLE REFSET snapshot.
Reference componentId and valueId pair is unique in the ATTRIBUTE VALUE snapshot.
All members refer to a description that is referenced in either the description table or the text definition table.
The current Language Refset snapshot file does not contain duplicate Member Ids.
Every concept's FSN exists exactly once in each language refset.
Preferred Term exists exactly once in each language refset for each concept.
There is a 1-to-1 relationship between the id and the immutable values in Inferred Relationship snapshot.
All destination ids found in the Inferred Relationship snapshot file exist in the Concept snapshot file.
All source ids found in the Inferred Relationship snapshot file exist in the Concept snapshot file.
All type ids found in the Inferred Relationship snapshot file exist in the Concept snapshot file.
There are no active additional relationships added in the current release.
The current Inferred Relationship snapshot file does not contain duplicate Relationship Ids.
There is a 1-to-1 relationship between the id and the immutable values in STATED RELATIONSHIP snapshot.
The current Stated Relationship snapshot file does not contain duplicate Relationship Ids.
All destination ids found in the Stated Relationship snapshot file exist in the Concept snapshot file.
All source ids found in the Stated Relationship snapshot file exist in the Concept snapshot file.
All type ids found in the Stated Relationship snapshot file exist in the Concept snapshot file.
The characteristic type id must be Stated in the stated relationship snapshot file
There are no duplicate Definition terms in the DEFINITION snapshot file.
ComplexMap refset id is unique in the snapshot file
Extendedmap refset id must be unique in the snapshot file
The module id of all SimpleMap members should be the core module id.
The current Relationship Concrete Values snapshot file does not contain duplicate Ids.
All source ids found in the Relationship Concrete Values snapshot file exist in the Concept snapshot file.
All type ids found in the Relationship Concrete Values snapshot file exist in the Concept snapshot file.
ReferenceComponentIds refers to valid concepts in the LOINC ExpressionAssociationRefset snapshot file.
ID is unique in the LOINC ExpressionAssociationRefset snapshot.
ReferenceComponentIds refers to valid concepts in the LOINC MapCorrelationOriginRefset snapshot file.
ID is unique in the LOINC MapCorrelationOriginRefset snapshot.
Every active concept defined in the Danish extension has a preferred FSN in the en-US language refset.
Every active concept has a preferred FSN in the en-GB language refset.
Every active concept defined in the Swedish extension has a preferred FSN in the en-US language refset.
Every active concept defined in the Belgian extension has a preferred FSN in the en-US language refset.
Every active concept defined in the Norwegian extension has a preferred FSN in the en-US language refset.
Every active concept defined in the Swiss extension has a preferred FSN in the en-US language refset.
Every active concept defined in the Irish extension has a preferred FSN in the en-US language refset.
Every active concept defined in the Estonian extension has a preferred FSN in the en-US language refset.
Every active concept has one active preferred term in the Danish language refset
Every active concept has one active preferred term in the en-GB language refset.
Every active concept has one active preferred term in the Swedish language refset.
Every active concept has one active preferred term in the Irish language refset.
Every active concept has one active preferred term in the Chinese language refset.
Every active concept has one active preferred term in the Belgian French language refset.
Every active concept has one active preferred term in the Belgian Dutch language refset.
Every active concept has one active preferred term in the Swiss German language refset.
Every active concept has one active preferred term in the Swiss French language refset.
Every active concept has one active preferred term in the Swiss Italian language refset.
Every active concept has one active preferred term in the Norwegian language refset.
Every active concept has one active preferred term in the Estonian language refset.
Newly added active concept has one active preferred term in the Swedish language refset.
Newly added active concept has one active preferred term in the Danish language refset.
Newly added active International concept must have at least one active preferred term in the Irish language refset RF2 file.
Newly added active concept has one active preferred term in the Belgian Dutch language refset.
Newly added active concept has one active preferred term in the Belgian French language refset.
Newly translated concepts must have preferred terms in Dutch and French.
An active description must not have preferred term in both Dutch and French language refset.
Every active concept from the international release is recommended to have one active preferred term in the Belgian French language refset.
Every active concept from the international release is recommended to have one active preferred term in the Belgian Dutch language refset.
Every active concept from the international release is recommended to have one active preferred term in the Danish language refset.
Every active concept from the international release is recommended to have one active preferred term in the Swedish language refset.
Every active concept from the international release is recommended to have one active preferred term in the Irish language refset.
Active historical association refset members have active concepts as targets.
No active Historical Association member associates an inactive concept with its parent.
Active historical association refset members have inactive concepts as reference components.
The definition status is PRIMITIVE for concepts having only one defining relationship.
All inferred relationships in which the concept associated is inactive, are inactive relationships.
Inferred relationship modifier is always SOME.
All inferred is-a relationships have relationship group of 0.
All concepts have at least one inferred is-a relationship.
No Concept has 2 inferred relationships with the same type, destination and group.
All stated relationships in which the source concept is inactive, are inactive relationships.
Stated relationship modifier is always SOME.
All stated is-a relationships have relationship group of 0.
For each active FSN there is a synonym that has the same text.
For a given concept, all description terms are unique.
No active term matches that of an inactive Description.
No new active term matches that of an inactive Description.
Case-sensitive terms that share initial words also share caseSignificanceId value.
Active description of active concept consists of valid characters.
The FSN term should be unique in active content when case sensitivity is ignored.
There is only one active member per description per dialect in the language refset snapshot file.
There is only one member id per description per dialect in the language refset snapshot file.
Lang refset members are active for inactive descriptions in the language refset snapshot file.
Descriptions in a language refset are unique for a given concept.
Members are active for active descriptions in the language refset snapshot file.
SNOMED RT identifier simple map refset refers to active components.
There is one and only one SNOMED RT simple map refset member per concept.
SNOMED RT identifier simple map refset members are unique.
CTV3 simple map refset members are unique.
There is one and only one CTV3 simple map refset member per concept.
CTV3 simple map refset members are always active.
Active VTM simple refset members refer to active components.
Active VMP simple refset members refer to active components.
Active Non-human refset members refer to active components.
Terms that contain en-us specific words are in the en-us language refset.
Terms that contain en-gb specific words are in the en-gb language refset.
Metadata concepts must only exist in model component module.
There is an equivalent definition in the en-us and en-gb language when provided.
Core module concepts have core module parents.
Active structure concepts are unique in SEP reference sets.
Active fully-defined concept must have at least one Axiom record with the words 'EquivalentClasses'.
Active concepts must have correct definition status according to defined axioms.
All referenced concepts in MRCM refsets must be active.
Role Group numbers are in double figures.
Concept should not have any duplicated historical association indicators.
Active concepts do not have active inactivation indicators
Active descriptions do not have active inactivation indicators
Active descriptions of an inactive concept should have concept non-current indicators
There is only one active inactivation reason for a given referenced component in the attribute value snapshot
Active preferred terms for active concepts are unique in the same hierarchy
All active FSNs for a given concept have the same semantic tag.
CTV3 codes are unique in the CTV3 simple map refset
SNOMED RT codes are unique in the SNOMED RT simple map refset
Rule based complex MapGroup must be in sequential order and not blank
MapPriority must be in sequential order
Gender rules must be in alphabetical order in complex map refset
Active complex maps should not have the same mapTarget in different groups for a given referenced component
Active higher mapGroup must have at least one non empty mapTarget
Non empty mapTarget should be part of mapAdvice
Active complex map IFA rules referenced concepts and terms must be active
Active extended maps have valid mapCategoryId
Active ICD 10 extended maps must have valid mapAdvice values for corresponding mapCategory
Active rule based extended map must have sequentially ordered mapGroup values without gaps
Active extended maps that are rule based have sequentially ordered mapPriority values without gaps within each mapGroup
Active extended maps should not have the same mapTarget and mapRule in different groups for a given referenced component
Active higher extended mapGroup have at least one non blank mapTarget
MapTarget should not be empty for classifiable mapCategory
Gender rules must be in alphabetical order in extended map refset
Active extended IFA rule maps reference active concepts and terms
Active extended map with age rules do not have mapRule value ending with less or equal than 0
The mapRule for active rule based extended maps should end with a default rule and not blank
Active rule based extended maps do not have the same mapRule and mapTarget in a different mapGroup
Active extended map with gender mapAdvice must have corresponding gender rule
The concepts referenced by expressions in LOINC ExpressionAssociationRefset SNAPSHOT file must exist in the concept snapshot
The mapTarget in LOINC ExpressionAssociationRefset snapshot is unique.
The mapTarget in LOINC ExpressionAssociationRefset snapshot is a valid LOINC code
The LOINC parts in MapCorrelationOriginRefset snapshot are in correct format
Newly inactive concepts must have an active historical association to an active concept - unless indicator NCEP.
Concepts inactivated in this release cycle must have an active Preferred Term in both US and GB Language Reference Sets.
Concepts inactivated in this release cycle must have an active FSN, preferred in both US and GB Language Reference Sets.
There must be actual changes made to previously published OWL Expression files in order for them to appear in the current delta.
The current full OWL Expression file consists of the previously published full file and the changes for the current release
All OWL Expression inactivated in current release must have been active in the previous release.
The current OWL Expression snapshot file is an accurate derivative of the current full file
The current data in the OWL Expression snapshot file are the same as the data in the current delta file.
The current OWL Expression full file contains all previously published data unchanged.
The current OWL Expression delta file is an accurate derivative of the current full file
The current OWL Expression snapshot file does not contain duplicate Ids.

All active Refset records are valid.

ID is unique in MRCM DOMAIN snapshot.
ID is unique in MRCM ATTRIBUTE DOMAIN snapshot.
ID is unique in MRCM ATTRIBUTE RANGE snapshot.
ID is unique in MRCM MODULE SCOPE snapshot.
ReferencedComponentId in MRCM ATTRIBUTE DOMAIN SNAPSHOT exists in the ReferencedComponentId values of MRCM ATTRIBUTE RANGE SNAPSHOT.
DomainId in MRCM ATTRIBUTE DOMAIN SNAPSHOT exists in the ReferencedComponentId values of MRCM DOMAIN SNAPSHOT
Grouped value is either 0 or 1 in MRCM ATTRIBUTE DOMAIN snapshot file
